statement.p: The curve x\fe{\sin}{xy}=y is shown in .

paragraphs.p: Find a formula for \lz{y}{x} and use that formula to determine the x-coordinate at each of the two points the curve crosses the x-axis. (Note: The tangent line to the curve is vertical at each of these points.) Scales have deliberately been omitted in .

statement.p: Solutions to the equation \fe{\ln}{x^2y^2}=x+y are graphed in .

paragraphs.p: Determine the equation of the tangent line to this curve at the point \point{1}{-1}.

hint.p: It is easier to differentiate if you first use rules of logarithms to completely expand the logarithmic expression.

introduction.p: Use the process of logarithmic differentiation to find a first derivative formula for each of the following functions.
